title: The Coincheck Heist
description: A quick, practical guide to The Coincheck Heist.

hook.text: In January 2018, hackers stole $530 million in NEM tokens from Japan's Coincheck exchange in a single attack.

buildup.text: Coincheck stored the NEM tokens in a hot wallet â€” connected to the internet â€” instead of secure cold storage.

discovery.text: The hackers drained the entire NEM balance in one transaction. Coincheck didn't notice for hours.

twist.text: Coincheck survived. The company used its own capital to reimburse all 260,000 affected customers in full.

climax.text: Japan tightened crypto regulations after the hack. Coincheck was later acquired by a major financial group.

punchline.text: Half a billion stolen because tokens sat in a hot wallet.

quiz.question: Why was the Coincheck hack possible?
options: NEM tokens were stored in an internet-connected hot wallet
